H0.text: Density is the property that Robin most likely compared with a balance while examining the properties of some rocks.

H1.text: Mass is the property that Robin most likely compared with a balance when she compared the properties of some rocks.

H2.text: Temperature is the property that Robin most likely compared with a balance when she compared the properties of some rocks.

H3.text: Volume is the property that Robin most likely compared with a balance when she compared the properties of some rocks.

A4.text: Assuming the gravitational field is equivalent on both sides of the balance, a balance measures relative weight, giving the relative gravitation mass of each object.

A5.text: The Roman pound and ounce were both defined in terms of different sized collections of the same common mass standard, the carob seed.
